Professional Experience

Teaching Aide | Nanjing, China

  • Work with UCLA Global Classroom instructors in the delivery of University Extension (UNEX) course content at Jinling High School (金陵中学) in Nanjing, one of the top public high schools in Jiangsu Province that has earned distinction as one of China’s “100 Key Schools.”
  • Guide high school students with academic reading, writing and presentation as well as critical thinking and analysis in the humanities and social sciences subjects.
  • Aid in delivery of Advanced Placement (AP) courses and credit-bearing UCLA courses to high school students in the Zhongmei Ban Program/中美班 (ZMB/ “China-America Program”).
  • Facilitate 15 hours per week of class instruction, in addition to office hours and participation in school activities.
  • See My Teaching for more information.

Graduate Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Edit, update, and maintain web content for the East Asian Library (EAL) Website using Drupal web content management software.
  • Apply design thinking approach to improve user experience and content of website.
  • Enrich EAL’s online presence with greater depth of content including information documenting major programs, exhibitions, and activities.
  • Assist with programs, projects, and other activities as needed, including the East Asian Library 70th Anniversary Celebration.
  • Co-designed a 20-page program brochure for the official 70th Anniversary Celebration event at the UCLA East Asian Library.
  • Perform public reference services and staff the reference service desk.

Academic Library Intern | Interlochen, MI

  • Work with circulation, shelving, processing of new acquisitions, and implementation of summer library programs.
  • Help users navigate a diverse array of collections which support the academic programs at Interlochen, including creative writing, comparative arts, dance, motion picture arts, music, theatre, liberal arts, math and science, and visual arts.
  • Perform reference duties and help individuals of various ages and interests find information through subscription databases, research guides, and the library catalog.
  • Design and implement library exhibitions and projects under supervision of academic library director, including those relating to specific collections, themed displays, and more.
  • Perform overlay cataloging to streamline classification systems used to organize music collections in the Academic Library.

Instructional Design Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Design and implement fresh innovative approaches to library instructional services and information literacy initiatives.
  • Work with an interdisciplinary team to create and assess learning objects for use in both asynchronous and synchronous instructional settings.
  • Apply technology skills and design thinking approach to create dynamic and engaging learner-centered experiences embedded into class curriculum.
  • Become familiar with creating documentation and project workflows through the use of team-based project management software: Trello, Asana.

Digital Archiving Project Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Work under supervision of Dr. Shawn Vancour (UCLA Information Studies Dept).
  • The UCLA Digital Archiving Collective Visiting Speaker Series was a newly launched series that ran from Fall 2017-Spring 2018 which focused on issues in digital archiving and offered a platform for thoughtful discussion on topics such as collection sustainability, legal and ethical issues, access and outreach, and data management. This series was made possible through a grant from UCLA Interdisciplinary and Cross Campus Affairs (ICCA) and subsequent support from the UCLA Digital Humanities Program.
  • Distribute official publicity announcements to designated communications officers in ten departments/centers across the UCLA campus, including: Information Studies Department; UCLA Film & Television Archive; Theater, Film & Television Department; Music Department; Music Library; Ethnomusicology Department; Communication Studies Department; UCLA Library; Digital Humanities; Bunche Center; UCLA Asian American Studies Center; UCLA American Indian Studies Center; and UCLA Chicano Studies Research Center.
  • Handle communications among core members, hosts, and series coordinator regarding venue set-up, event catering, A/V technology team, guest attendance, publicity, and inquiries from speakers.

Jazz Archives Fellow | Newark, NJ

  • Selected to work with a team of two other archives fellows to develop a digital project over the course of a two-week jazz archives fellowship (June 11-22, 2017).
  • Arrange and describe a representative collection under the supervision of the IJS’s archivists and collaborate on a collection guide/finding aid.
  • Engage in discussions and learning opportunities about archival and digital collection management issues, as well as meet with Rutgers faculty, staff, and administrators on issues of diversity and how it can be served by a specialized archive like the IJS.
  • Participate in site visits to several New York metropolitan area archives including the Carnegie Hall Archives, New York Philharmonic Archives, Louis Armstrong Archives, National Jazz Museum, and Thomas Edison National Historical Park.
  • See the Rutgers University Institute of Jazz Studies Website and the Rutgers University Institute of Jazz Studies Archival Fellows Program Website for more information.

Music Archives Intern | Los Angeles, CA

  • Identify errors and revise finding aid for the Piatigorsky Archive using ArchivesSpace.
  • Export finding aid using ArchivesSpace to the Online Archive of California (OAC).
  • Register the Piatigorsky Archives as an official contributing institution on OAC.
  • Refine internal collection inventory lists and make them more searchable by staff.
  • Engage in reference and inquiry services for users requesting access to archival materials.
  • Process and catalog new donations of books and textile/clothing material into the archive’s finding aid.
  • Participate in outreach and exhibition planning activities for exhibitions and film screening events on Piatigorsky – i.e., assisting supervisor in recording measurements of physical exhibition space, researching existing exhibitions (such as ‘Jazz at the Hollywood Bowl’)
  • Assist with planning exhibition layout, selecting display themes, and curating potential exhibition materials from the Piatigorsky Archives.
  • See the Piatigorsky Archives Website for more information. You may also access the Piatigorsky Archives Finding Aid on the Online Archive of California.

International Institute Graduate Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Collaborate with a team of UCLA faculty, International Institute staff, IT managers, senior web developers, and other graduate assistants to prepare for major launch events and manage profiles of significant Chinese and Chinese American donors.
  • Operate in a dynamic, multilingual/cross-cultural environment.
  • Modify and manage web content using Webtools.
  • Write, translate, and publish web pages in three scripts: English, traditional Chinese, and simplified Chinese.
  • Copy edit English-to-Chinese translations before final publication.
  • See The Global Chinese Philanthropy Initiative (GCPI) Website for more information.

Graduate Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Provide assistance to fellow students enrolled in the degree programs at UCLA Graduate School of Education and Information Studies (GSEIS), as well as to faculty of the UCLA Department of Information Studies in the use of workstations, networked information resources, online services, print and other multimedia resources in the IS Lab.
  • Provide support to the professional staff in day-to-day operations and maintenance of the IS Lab and its collections.
  • Assist and/or lead instruction during workshops presented by the IS Lab.
  • Identify and take on special assignments or projects that address and/or resolve extant need(s) of the Information Studies lab.
  • Assume responsibility of lab operations during respective work hours.

Administrative Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Engage multiple tasks and transition among roles seamlessly in a team setting.
  • Adapt to new situations quickly and effectively.
  • Provide extra support and assistance to staff members at the Information Technology Center as needed.
  • Apply bilingual language skills in work with international visitors and scholars (functional proficiency in Mandarin, the most common Chinese dialect, and native proficiency in English).
  • Maintain and set-up conference rooms at the IT Center for meetings by faculty and staff, as well as visitors to CSUN.

Graduate Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Assisted in providing a creative and productive work space for faculty and students in the College of Humanities (both undergraduate and graduate) to conduct and complete unique research projects.
  • Communicated efficiently with faculty and students to meet the distinct needs of different projects, which spanned the fields of Digital Humanities, Asian American Studies, Language and Linguistics, Religious Studies, and more.
  • Processed booking requests from faculty and students for the Humanities Research Lab, managed lab technology, and monitored and recorded lab use during individual/group research work sessions.

Archival Processing Intern | Los Angeles, CA

  • Arranged and described a manuscript collection held by CSUN’s Special Collections and Archives Department.
  • Completed assigned readings to aid in processing an assigned collection: The Carl Sandburg Collection.
  • Performed basic preservation work.
  • Created required internal documentation during processing.
  • Helped create a finding aid for the assigned collection.
  • Spent approximately 140 hours over the course of the semester on the project.

Music & Media Collections Processor, Assistant to the Director | Los Angeles, CA (May 2014 – May 2016)

  • Coordinated with faculty members and staff for film and media resource requests.
  • Processed newly arrived music and media materials in preparation for shelving.
  • Collaborated with members of other library departments to complete internal projects.
  • Assisted area supervisor in conducting trainings, creating documentation, and developing orientation materials for new student assistants.
  • Co-curated and organized Chinese art/calligraphy exhibitions showcasing the culture and works of local and international artisans at Oviatt Library’s Music & Media Department.
  • Past and current exhibition projects include: “Chinese New Year and Cultural Exhibition,” “Chinese Film Festival,” “American Indian History Month,” “Chinese Painting and Calligraphy,” and “Chinese Porcelain Painting Exhibition.”

Library Reference & Bookings Assistant | Los Angeles, CA (Aug 2012 – May 2014)

  • Guided library patrons, faculty & students in locating resources in the collection.
  • Assisted area supervisor in the training and adjustment of new student workers.
  • Efficiently worked with faculty to create bookings for in-class film showings.
  • Organized and curated artistic and cultural exhibitions, including Chinese New Year, Porcelain and Watercolor Paintings, and Chinese Calligraphy.

International Programs Intern | Nanjing, China

  • Performed Chinese Mandarin to English oral translation for faculty-led workshops on calligraphy and martial arts for international students.
  • Assisted with two international student cohorts from Sweden and the U.S. with adjusting to university life at NUST, English translation, and cultural events.
  • Served as a tour guide and English translator for international student field trips to Shanghai, Suzhou, the Yellow Mountains and Sun Yat Sen Mausoleum in Nanjing.
  • Applied skills in digital photography and English writing to improve NUST International Programs Office’s promotional materials and website.
  • Conducted a study/interviews of international students from America and Sweden, documenting their cultural experiences in China.
  • Published resulting findings in a photojournalistic article in the CSUN China Institute Annual Newsletter.

English Translator for International Programs | Beijing, China

  • Translated and edited research articles for UIBE faculty and students submitted for publication in academic journals.
  • Served as English translator in a UIBE research team on their visit to the manufacturing facilities of Nestlé company in Inner Mongolia, China.

International Program Student Assistant | Los Angeles, CA

  • Helped newly arrived international students in obtaining consultations with international advisors, assisted with questions on visa paperwork, and gave them brief orientations about on-campus services and resources.
  • Assisted the IESC Advisers in creating positive relations and interactions with international students and in handling unexpected emergency situations (i.e., health or family emergencies, admission and enrollment issues, urgent travel requests, etc.).

English Tutor and Translator | Los Angeles, CA

  • Supervised a Chinese elementary school student group from Wuhan Foreign Languages School (WFLS) on their classroom study at Vaughn Next Century Learning Center (VNCLC) in Pacoima.
  • Chaperoned WFLS student group on their visits to L.A., San Francisco, and Hawaii.
  • Conducted an interview study with WFLS students reflecting on their cultural exchange program.
  • Authored photojournalistic article, which was published in VNCLC and CSUN China Institute newsletters.

English and Music Instructor | Wuhan, China

  • Taught English and music to second grade elementary school students at WFLS.
  • Assisted school principal and staff in conducting interviews of American teachers applying for instructor positions in WFLS.
  • Served as guest judge for English language competitions.
  • Joined a special WFLS teacher delegation to teach in a rural school in Tian Shang Ping, Hubei, China, where the team’s volunteer work transformed the run-down rural school into a clean and beautiful setting with a fully-functioning kitchen and a “Happy Dining Room” to serve hot lunches to the school children.

Sales Ambassador | Beverly Hills, CA

  • Utilized bilingual language skills in Mandarin Chinese and English to translate for and provide guided assistance to Chinese customers and tour groups.
  • Assisted Saks’ administrators in creating a friendly and culturally relevant atmosphere for international customers.

English Tutor for Shanghai Principals Delegation | Los Angeles, CA

  • Utilized digital photography and visual editing skills to document important events and moments at CSUN’s training workshops for Shanghai School Principals.

Copy Editor | Los Angeles, CA

  • Copy edited student articles for publication in the Daily SunDial university newspaper.

Collaborative Pianist, Singer, and Soloist | Multiple Cities, China
